instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.5V_S5: What is 5V_S5? 5V_S5 is an abbreviation for “PP5V_S5” which is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: this is my personal machine. coffee was spilled on it about 18 months ago with no major corrosion.  Just died on me today.  I found that <SIGNAL>PP5_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> was missing and with a little more troublshooting found no PM-SLP-<SIGNAL>S4_L</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: You have to have <SIGNAL>5V_S5</SIGNAL> before you get <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>. Green light present? PPBUS voltage? VRTC voltage? Voltage on <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: well, it's working now, it appears to have fixed itself.  not the first time probing around got the fan spinning again.
